stories.title: Hubble Telescope Zooms in on the Biggest Comet Ever Spotted

stories.text: Does anyone remember a recent post here with a description of a note taking method (with pictures). I don't think it was quite kettelkasten. What I think I recall from the post: each lecture got a single page, the pages were mostly visual with concepts drawn and text to explain. I find myself working on a tool to use ML to aggregate knowledge and that visual keeps floating to the surface. I think if I could see that image again it would inspire a cleaner and more intuitive way of displaying information.
stories.title: Ask HN: Recent post containing beautiful single page notes?
Dirk Hohndel: Linux, Linus, Licenses, and the Business of Open Source
Remembering Gagarin, remember Ukrainians who made his flight possible
Will Google Create an AI God?

stories.text:
In particular, suppose I introduce a new rule in level 10 but the player decides to replay some earlier levels. The new rule doesn't apply to to them but the player may have forgotten that.

And so it would not be clear which rules are active when replaying earlier levels.

Is there a good solution to this problem?
stories.title: Ask HN: How to introduce game rules gradually without breaking earlier levels?
We Can Help Ukraine – In the Long Run
State the Problem Before Describing the Solution [pdf]
